Package network_structures

Class BaseMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • network_structures.BaseMessage
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Server.Task
    public class BaseMessage
extends java.lang.Object
    Class representing single message used for local communication (eg. between threads) and task scheduling. Since the class does not give any guarantee as for the possibility of serialization it shouldn't be used for network communication. For such purpose use NetworkMessage instead. The message should be constructed with following assumptions: command should be string recognized by receiving side; args should be array of strings containing modifiers specific to this particular command; data should contain any form of data needed to execute the command, such as collections. Since this data is not guaranteed to be serializable, notable use case is to transmit callback objects; communicationIdentifier should be zero if we are not expecting an answer, any non-zero long integer otherwise; It must be noted that all fields except data are immutable if accessed through proper accessor methods. Within server's code this structure is often used for inter-thread communication.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      BaseMessage​(java.lang.String command, java.lang.String[] args, java.lang.Object data)
      Siplified constructor for creating conversation-independent messages.
      BaseMessage​(java.lang.String command, java.lang.String[] args, java.lang.Object data, long communicationIdentifier)
      Creates NetworkMessage with provided arguments; since fields are final, they cannot be change later.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static BaseMessage convertToBaseMessage​(NetworkMessage networkMessage)
      Converts given NetworkMessage to BaseMessage; Since NetworkMessage.getData() makes only a shallow copy of data field, it's advised to abandon the NetworkMessage reference thereafter.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BaseMessage

        public BaseMessage​(java.lang.String command,
                   java.lang.String[] args,
                   java.lang.Object data,
                   long communicationIdentifier)
        Creates NetworkMessage with provided arguments; since fields are final, they cannot be change later.
        Parameters:
        command - Command to execute by receiver
        args - Arguments detailing the command
        data - Any form of data required for execution of this command, including callbacks
        communicationIdentifier - Unique communication identifier for this message used by receiver for replying

        public java.lang.Object getData()

        Returns:
        Serializable containing data assigned to this message

      • convertToBaseMessage

        public static BaseMessage convertToBaseMessage​(NetworkMessage networkMessage)
        Converts given NetworkMessage to BaseMessage; Since NetworkMessage.getData() makes only a shallow copy of data field, it's advised to abandon the NetworkMessage reference thereafter.

        networkMessage - NetworkMessage to convert
        Returns:
        BaseMessage conversion of NetworkMessage
